author: Alessandra
name: Slow herby squash and beans - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Slow herby squash and beans - vegan. This dish takes longer than the kind of thing i usually cook ... but it’s worth the wait!

Perfect for a cold day and the flavours are amazing. Serve with some crusty bread to soak up the sauce 😍

If you have any left over/ or if you make more...

ingredients.name: Use a pan that can be used on the stove top and in the oven and that has a lid
onion squash, halved... then scoop the seeds out and cut into wedges (around 2cm thick) - delicata squash also works; butternut probably will too
sprigs of fresh rosemary and/ or thyme and/or sage
can of cannellini or butter beans, drained and rinsed
cavolo nero - shredded into smaller pieces
Optional: another bunch of cavolo nero, steamed for a couple of minutes to serve

instructions: Heat the oil in the pan. Add the squash. Fry for about 5 mins on each side so it’s starting to caramelise. Take the squash out and set to one side.
Add the onions to the pan. (It probably doesn’t need more oil.) Cook for about 10 mins until the onions soften.
When the onions are softened, add the herbs and a few grinds of pepper. Then add the stock and the squash. Bring to the boil and then turn the heat down, put the lid on and simmer for 20 mins.
Preheat the oven at 200C.
Add the beans to the pot and put the lid back on. Then put the pot in the oven and cook for 45 mins.
After 45 mins, add the cavolo nero to the pan. Leave the lid off and put back in the oven for 10-15mins.
Serve on the extra cavolo nero if you’re using. Enjoy 😋

author: Mikala
name: Vegan Sausage Casserole Recipe by Mikala - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Sausage Casserole.
instructions: Cook spaghetti
Oven cook sausages
Fry onions and garlic in a large pot then add vegetables and herbs, add stock and bring to boil then simmer

author: Foodiegeektrish
name: Vegan tomato tart Recipe by Foodiegeektrish - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan tomato tart. Remember those tomatoes that smelt as good as they looked. The one you would sneak into the hot green house and take straight of the vine.....
instructions: Thinly slice the tomato add a little salt. This will draw some moisture out
Cut a square of pastry then in opposite corners cut as the image
Layer on the tomatoes
Now fold the pastry over the tomato this shows how to fold
Glaze and bake 15-20 @180

author: Alessandra
name: Veggie noodle soup - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Veggie noodle soup - vegan. This soup is delicious! 
It’s also adaptable ... add more mushrooms if you like them, switch the broccoli for green beans, skip the corn... 

If you’re suffering with a cold/ flu, add more garlic/ ginger/ chilli.

ingredients.name: leek, finely chopped - add an extra spring onion if you don’t have a leek
spring onions, finely chopped - save 2 for later
chunk of ginger, peeled and grated
shitake mushrooms, torn into small pieces
sweetcorn - fresh/ frozen/ tinned (if tinned, no salt or sugar added)
vegan/ veggie stock (more of you want a soupier soup)
tatsoi or pak choi or other leafy green
Buckwheat noodles/ noodles of your choice - enough for two

instructions: For the noodles: cook according to packet instructions but for 1-2 minutes less time than recommended.
Heat the oil in a pan (with a lid for later). Add the leek and two of the spring onions. Sauté until the leek starts to soften.
Add the ginger and garlic. Sauté for another 2-3 mins.
Add the mushrooms. Cook for 4-5 mins.
Add the star anise, broccoli and sweetcorn.
Add the stock. Put the lid on and simmer until the broccoli is just tender.
Add the cooked noodles to the pot. And sugar snaps and tatsoi/ pak choi/ leafy greens. And tofu if using. Stir through so the greens just start to wilt.
Turn off the heat. Add the tamari and lemon. Season.
Serve with the coriander/ chilli/ extra spring onions on top. Enjoy 😋

author: Yui Miles
name: Tomyum Noodles with mushrooms (vegan) Recipe by Yui Miles - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Tomyum Noodles with mushrooms (vegan). This is a really tasty, spicy and delicious plantbase Thai noodles dish with a twist 🍜. A lot of supermarket in UK now store some Asian ingredients now so it’s quite easy to buy these authentic ingredients these days. Here is my Vegan Thai...

ingredients.name: mushrooms of your choice (I use oyster mushrooms and Enoki mushrooms)
chilli jam or chilli oil (choose vegan version if you prefer)

instructions: Prepare all these ingredients to make vegan tomyum noodle soup.

Boil clean water in a medium side saucepan. Once water is boiling, add rice noodle in and cook for 5-6 min. Sieve them out and transfer to a mixing bowl. Add some cooking oil and mix well to stop noodle stick together.
On the same saucepan, add a little more water, wait until water boiling again then add some lemon grass, soysauce and chilli jam or chilli oil. Mix well.
Add some fresh chilli, lime juice and kaffir lime leaves then mix well.
Add some mushrooms, sugar and leave them to cook for about 5 minutes.
Serving time, separate noodle into 2 bowls, add some beans sprouts on top, then add some soup, mushrooms, coriander and can top up with more lime and chilli flakes if prefer.

author: Sameera Sood
name: Stir fry noodles (Veggie, Vegan) Recipe by Sameera Sood - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Stir fry noodles (Veggie, Vegan).
instructions: Stir fry Noodles - Stir fry onion, garlic, carrots for 4-5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Then add the boiled spaghetti. Grate half nutmeg on top after switching off the stove. Give it a good mix.
Dressing - In a bowl, pour the balsamic vinegar. Now add grated ginger and finely chopped basil leaves. Whisk it for a minute.
For serving

author: Laura Haworth
name: 16:48 - Thai green curry vegan style Recipe by Laura Haworth - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for 16:48 - Thai green curry vegan style. I love green curry; so fragrant yet rich with coconut milk and warming spices and it's one of my comfort dishes on a cold, wintry evening.  I typically associate green curry with chicken but I had a guest for dinner who's vegan so I had a...

ingredients.name: Thai green chillies (or more if you like it hot)
oil - cold-pressed rapeseed with lemongrass, ginger and chilli
medium onions, peeled and finely chopped
medium sweet potato, peeled and cubed
remainder of the can of coconut milk

instructions: Roughly chop all the ingredients for the paste and place in a pestle and mortar and bash away. Add 4 tablespoons of the coconut milk and continue to grind until you have a paste. If pounding isn't your thing, place in a food processor and blend.
To make the sauce, heat the oil in a large pan and saute the onions for 3-4 minutes until soft.
Add the sweet potato and aubergine chunks and cook for a further 5 minutes until they start to soften.
Add the paste and continue to cook for 5 minutes.
Add the lime leaves and the coconut milk and cook for a further 10-15 minutes until the vegetables are soft.
Roughly chop the cashew nuts and coriander and add to the sauce with a squeeze of lime.
Serve with jasmine rice.

author: Laura Haworth
name: LI7 - Magic Wand (vegan) Recipe by Laura Haworth - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for LI7 - Magic Wand (vegan). This 'throw it all in a bowl' salsa bean salad provides a whacking amount of the daily required micro-nutrients:

3x vitamins A, C
all the daily fibre
70% carbs
60% protein, iron
40% potassium
30% calcium

Micro-nutrients, described by the WHO (World...
instructions: Throw it all in a bowl, stir and enjoy

author: thenakedladycookies
name: Vegan Gingerbread Recipe by thenakedladycookies - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Vegan Gingerbread. This is the gingerbread recipe that is used as chunks within our gingerbread cookie for @thenakedladycookies

https://www.instagram.com/thenakedladycookies/
instructions: Add the brown sugar to the coconut oil.
Then add vanilla essence and aquafaba.
Sift flour in a separate bowl, add rest of the dry ingredients (baking soda, salt, ground ginger, cinnamon & all spice).
Mix the wet and dry ingredients together.
Roll out the mixture, and cut out shapes.
Place on baking tray and bake for 10 minutes at 180 degrees.

author: Laura Haworth
name: 11 - Daikon dal Mex style (vegan) Recipe by Laura Haworth - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for 11 - Daikon dal Mex style (vegan). I adore fusion cooking.  This dish combines the sweet, spicy flavours of Rajasthan with some heavenly warm, dark flavours from Mexico.

Rummaging in the kitchen I came across half a daikon lurking in the fridge and I always have an array of...

ingredients.name: green split lentils (or whatever lentils you have)
small piece of turmeric root grated or ½ teaspoon dried turmeric
tomatoes roughly chopped (or a tin of tomatoes)

instructions: Dice the daikon into cubes. Wash the lentils under running water until the water runs clear and set aside.

Heat a pan over medium flame and add the oil. Place the bay leaf, cloves and cumin seeds in the pan and when the seeds starts to crackle, add the ginger paste, green chilli and asafoetida. Saute the mixture for 5 minutes.
Add the daikon, lentils, chilli powder and mix them well until coated and cook for a further 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, tomato puree, water and salt. Place a lid on the pan and cook until the lentils are soft, adding more water if necessary.
Add in the chocolate and stir until melted.
Transfer the daikon dal into a bowl and garnish with coriander leaves and chilli. Serve with tacos or paratha.

author: Rachel
name: Vegan Ramen with soy milk and seasonal veg 🌱 Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Vegan Ramen with soy milk and seasonal veg 🌱. #oxfordstudents #cookingwithnawamin 
These soy milk ramen are delicious, full of umami from miso, mushrooms and seaweed. You can also buy ramen stick or cubes that you can use as a quick version. Any veggies seem to go with this, if...

ingredients.name: Ramen noodles (around a handful per person)
dashi stock (see vegan dashi recipe separately)
veg of your choice (I used carrot and sliced cabbage)

instructions: Cook the ramen noodles according to instructions. I like them firm and so I add the noodles and bring to the boil, turn off the heat and leave to soak for 5 minute before draining.

Heat the soy milk or ramen stock and add dashi stock, miso and mushrooms. If you wish you can add a little crushed ginger. Heat gently, being careful not to boil as the soup will foam. Taste and add a little more miso or dashI stock to your preference. Heat gently for around 10 minutes.
Add the veg of your choice. I like them to be crispy so I just heat through. Place the noodles in a bowl, add a strip of nori and pour the soup on to the noodles.
You can top the soup with toppings to your taste. Pickles, pickled veg, toasted sesame seeds, garlic or ginger, chilli powder, pickled cucumbers or cooked tofu.

author: Alessandra
name: Roast squash, leek and red onion - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Roast squash, leek and red onion - vegan. Easy roast vegetables that are great as a side or on their own with a big helping of greens. 

#onerecipeonetree

ingredients.name: onion squash, cut into small chunks
big leek, cut into thick slices
red onion, peeled and cut into wedges

instructions: Preheat oven to 200C.
In a bowl, put the vegetables. Add the oil and coat the vegetables. Season.
Put the vegetables on a lined roasting tray. Roast for about 20 mins.
Take out of the oven; sprinkle the almonds on top of the vegetables and lay the thyme on top. Put back in the oven for 10-15 mins.
Take the thyme sprigs off before serving. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: 10 minute soba special - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for 10 minute soba special - vegan. My go-to recipe for when i get home super-hungry. It’s delicious, healthy and filling ... and really does just take 10 minutes 🎉

#onerecipeonetree

ingredients.name: chunk of ginger(depending on how you feel about ginger), peeled and grated/ finely chopped
firm tofu, pressed and drained and cut into cubes
tatsoi or komatsuna or pak choi, torn into small pieces
Some shichimi if you have some or chill flakes - optional

instructions: Cook the soba according to the packet. When it’s ready, drain and rinse in cold water and set aside.
In a jug, mix the miso and water until the miso is dissolved.
Heat the oil in a pan on medium-hot heat. Add the spring onions and ginger. Cook for 2 mins.
Add the mushrooms and sauté for 2-3 mins.
Add the tofu and sesame seeds. Sauté for 1-2 mins.
Turn the heat down to low. Add the miso/ water. Stir the tatsoi through and leave for 1-2 mins.
You can add the soba to the tofu/ veg soup before serving. Or put the soba into bowls and then add the soup. Sprinkle with shichimi. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Braised peas and lettuce - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Braised peas and lettuce - vegan. This is a fresh spring/ summer dish. It’s good with rice or as a side. 
This is adapted from an Ottolenghi recipe.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large shallow pan. Add the spring onions and garlic and sauté for about 5 mins.
Add the peas, thyme and stock. Simmer for about 5 mins.
Add the lettuce on top. Cook for about 6 mins. Stir it every so often. The lettuce needs to go soft - but not soggy.
Take off the heat. Remove the thyme. Add the mint and stir through.
Season. Sprinkle some lemon zest on top. Enjoy 😋

author: Mykola Denysyuk
name: [vegan] Oats cookies with cashews leftovers Recipe by Mykola Denysyuk - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for [vegan] Oats cookies with cashews leftovers. Easy and fast cookies recipe for Sunday’s movie night

ingredients.name: cashew leftovers from the bottom of the packaging

instructions: Put sugar, 🍯, 🥥 oil (I usually keep it in solid state in the fridge so it might be a challenge to dig it from jar) and milk into big cup or bowl and melt it all together in microwave
So original recipe say to sieve flour, but I never do that. might worth a try though. mix in oats and baking powder
Stir melted liquid heavily until smooth, then add to dry ingredients and mix until it becomes creamy
Cover tray with backing paper and spoon the mix on it trying to make a round cookies shape. Leave room in between as they will grow while cooking

Sprinkle cashews over future cookies (you might use any nuts here and grind it into chunks by yourself, but fortunately for me I am buying big packs of cashews at stores where staff and another customers have lovely done it for me already, so I have plenty of cookies toppings)
Bake at 180C for 10-ish minutes until brown.

author: mk
name: Fish Amok Cambodian lemongrass curry, paleo- & vegan-friendly Recipe by mk - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Fish Amok Cambodian lemongrass curry, paleo- & vegan-friendly. Cambodian cooking is less spicy with more delicate tastes than Thai and this curry is no exception.  Lemongrass, ginger and turmeric are the backbone of the curry and the recipe can easily be made vegan by...

ingredients.name: Kafir Lime leaves OR 1/2 teaspoon lime zest and 1 1/2 teaspoon lime juice
fresh ginger or galangel root (or more to taste)
fresh chilli or 1/2 teaspoon chilli flakes (optional - to taste)
white fish, such as cod, haddock, pollock or sea bream (tofu/tempeh for the vegan option)

instructions: Lay out ingredients for curry paste and prepare the food processor
Roughly chop onion, garlic, ginger and lemongrass and combine in the food processor
Add kafir line leaves (or lime house and zest), turmeric, fish sauce, tamarind and maple syrup and blend until the paste is smooth
Melt coconut oil in a pan and add red pepper, cut in strips. (If you are making a vegetarian version add baby corn and green beans). Stir fry until vegetables soften but are not completely cooked.
Transfer the vegetables to a pan. Add coconut milk and curry paste and bring to a simmer.
Add fish and cook for 5-10 minutes.
Add spinach and cook for 3-4 minutes until done.
Serve with chopped coriander and/ fresh chilli as garnish. Enjoy!

author: Alessandra
name: Best tomato salad - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Best tomato salad - vegan. Mini #cookingdiscovery after eating something similar in a restaurant. This makes the most of the flavours of tomatoes; the marinading and the rosemary adds depth to a very simple dish 😋
instructions: In a bowl, whisk the oil and vinegar with a generous pinch of sea salt and a few grinds of pepper.
Put the tomatoes in a flat dish. Pour the oil mix gently on top of the tomatoes. Put a couple of sprigs of rosemary in the dish.
Put the dish in the fridge for a couple of hours.
To serve, lift the tomatoes carefully out of the oil mix and serve. Season again if needed. The oil mix can be used as a dressing on the side. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Warm green beans, peas and tarragon salad - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Warm green beans, peas and tarragon salad - vegan. A warm crunchy salad that’s lovely on it's own as a side or with a bit of feta or salmon. 
The dressing will jeep in the fridge for a few days.

ingredients.name: Small bunch of fresh tarragon , finely chopped

instructions: Heat some water in a pan. Put the green beans in a steamer; place the steamer on the pan and cover. Steam the beans for about 3 - 4 mins.
Add the peas to the steamer. Steam for another 2-3 mins - the beans and peas are still crisp but slightly tender.
Make the dressing by mixing all the ingredients together.
Mix the onion, tarragon and beans/ peas.
Drizzle with the dressing. Sprinkle with the pumpkin seeds. Enjoy 😋

author: Sonia
name: Cherry & Coconut Fool 🍒(Vegan) Recipe by Sonia - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Cherry & Coconut Fool 🍒(Vegan). I love mousses and fools, but I can’t eat dairy any more so I made this one with whipped coconut cream instead. You need to use a coconut milk without carageen to make this dessert. Blue dragon works. #berrybonanza #dairyfree #vegan
instructions: Put the whole can of coconut milk in the fridge for half an hour or so. Turn the tin upside down and open it. Pour off the separated coconut water into a jug. Scoop out the cream that’s left and put in a food processor or large bowl.

Put your cherries in a saucepan, add 3 tbsp of the coconut water from the jug. Heat the cherries until they are bubbling and starting to reduce down and get sticky. remove from the heat and cool in a bowl or on a plate.

Whip the coconut cream and maple syrup together until the cream is smooth and a little aerated. Then add 2/3 reds of your cooled cherry mixture. Spoon the fool into a serving dish (2 dishes if you’re not as greedy as me) the chill for 30 minutes.
Top with the remaining cherries and serve! 🍒

author: Alessandra
name: Strawberry milkshake - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Strawberry milkshake - vegan. So. Good.
The lemon zest makes it. 
 🍓🍓🍓
#berrybonanza

ingredients.name: unsweetened milk of choice - soy, almond, coconut, oat.

instructions: Put everything in the blender.
Blitz for a few minutes.
Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Warm Spring salad with roasted radishes, carrots and fennel - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Warm Spring salad with roasted radishes, carrots and fennel - vegan. I love radishes. Happy to eat them raw but they are also good roasted! They become a little sweeter. And are beautiful alongside some carrots and fennel on some rocket or baby leaves. 
The dukkah is a great...
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200C.
In a bowl, mix the vegetables with the oil and dukkah. Then lay out on a lined baking tray.
Roast for about 20mins. So the vegetables are tender.
Sprinkle some more dukkah on top - or sesame seeds - and a generous pinch of sea salt. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Sesame avocado and radish on toast - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Sesame avocado and radish on toast - vegan. Changing up avo on toast 🥑
Lovely with just the avo and radish. (Which also works as a side salad). 
For non-vegans, make it a bit extra by adding some crumbled feta or a poached egg 💖
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C.
Mix the radishes, oil and 1 tsp sesame seeds. Put onto line baking tray and cook for 15-20 mins until tender.
Prepare the avocado. When the radish is ready, combine with the avocado. Sprinkle with more sesame seeds and seasalt.
Eat with a slice of sourdough/rye/ bread of choice toasted and / or some feta or a poached egg. Enjoy 😋

author: Balint Dezso
name: Ultimate vegan grill cheese Recipe by Balint Dezso - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Ultimate vegan grill cheese.
instructions: Cut up the sausages in small circles.

Layer the cheese with generous overlap on one of the slices of bread and add the sausages on top. If the sausages don’t fit, make them fit! Add the rucola at this point on top of the sausages for health reasons.
Add a generous layer of vegan spicy mayo on the other side of the bread.
Wrap in wax paper and grill in a sandwich maker for about 5 minutes.

author: Alessandra
name: Chocolate Cherry Overnight Oats - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Chocolate Cherry Overnight Oats - vegan. This is delicious. Next time i’m going to do this just with chia pudding 💖
If you have some cacao nibs, add a couple of tsps. 
#berrybonanza #breakfast
instructions: Mix the oats, chia, milk and maple syrup together in a bowl. Refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, stir in the cacao and maybe some more milk depending on your preference.
Then put a layer of cherries in the bottom of a bowl, add a layer of the oat/ chia mix, add another layer of cherries and a final layer of oat/chia mix. Decorate with a few more cherries. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Sweet potato, spinach and coriander soup - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Sweet potato, spinach and coriander soup - vegan. This is a quick soup to make: there’s not a lot of ingredients and hardly any chopping! Bursting with flavour with a little kick from the cayenne 😋

ingredients.name: large sweet potato, chopped into chunks - don’t need to peel it

instructions: Heat the oil in a pan. Add the onion and sauté on a medium heat for about 10min til the onion is soft and translucent.
Add the garlic and sauté for a minute or two.
Add the sweet potato and stock. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 mins or so.
Put the sweet potato mix in a blender. Add the spinach, coriander, lemon juice and cayenne. Blitz until smooth. If using a hand blender, take the pan off the heat, add everything and then blend.
Taste - season as needed and maybe add another pinch of cayenne. Enjoy 😋

author: Balint Dezso
name: Ultimate vegan sausage and mushroom pasta Recipe by Balint Dezso - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Ultimate vegan sausage and mushroom pasta. This serves 3 good portions or 2 huge portions
instructions: Cook the pasta in some salt water and a little olive oil like Gordon Ramsey.
Saute the onions, garlic, sausages (sliced) and mushrooms in some olive oil. Add the other ingridients and cook for about 10 min.
Plate the pasta and the sauce and cover with grated cheese. Put the dish in the microwave for 2 minutes to melt the cheese.

author: Alessandra
name: Rainbow Buddha Bowl - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Rainbow Buddha Bowl - vegan. A bowl of crunchy goodness 😋 
You can use any vegetables! And also add some tofu or, if you’re not vegan, feta or even a soft boiled egg. 
You can keep everything raw but i like to lightly cook most of the vegetables. 
#eattherainbow

ingredients.name: red cabbage, cut into quarters and cooked for a few minutes in boiling water - add some vinegar to the cooking water so the cabbage doesn’t go blue!
carrots, sliced into ribbons (using a Y peeler works)
corn on the cob - cooked; or a can of sweetcorn
you can also add some grains eg cooked brown rice or some green leaves
tahini (runny or you may need more water)

instructions: For the dressing: mix everything together. Taste and add as needed.
Layer all the vegetables in a bowl.
Add the seeds, lemon zest. Drizzle the dressing on top. Enjoy 😋

author: Rachel
name: Miso mushroom vegan poke bowl #eattherainbow Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Miso mushroom vegan poke bowl #eattherainbow. #eattherainbow Full of fresh veggies, herbs and spices. This contained quite a lot of ingredients but almost all If them can be swapped to your taste or the veg that you have at home. I love to cook with miso, more miso recipes to...
instructions: Cook the sushi rice according to instructions. I’m lucky that my son is the sushi rice cooker in our house and he kindly made this. Add sushi vinegar and and rice wine if you wish.
Prepare the veggies, grate cabbage, carrot, ginger, slice cucumber
Marinade the oyster mushrooms in the miso paste and a little soy sauce and sesame oil. Dry fry until cooked.

Add sushi rice to your bowl and assemble vegetable around. Add mushrooms, chopped chilli, a squeeze of lime and sprinkle with soy sauce and shichimi powder to your taste. We had some left overs and so prepared one for tomorrow’s lunchbox.

author: Rachel
name: Vegan Firecracker Rice #eattherainbow Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Firecracker Rice #eattherainbow. Very simple and delicious. As with most of my recipes you can use the veg you prefer that you have at home.

ingredients.name: Chopped veg - pepper, carrots, courgette, edamame beans or peas
shakes of shichimi to your taste

instructions: Heat the oil to a high heat in the pan. When hot quick fry the chopped veg. When the veg is cooked add the rice and combine with the veg. Keep the food moving until piping hot.
Serve in a bowl and serve with the soy sauce, lime and sprinkle with the Japanese chilli powder. It’s ready to eat.

author: Sameera Sood
name: Veggie wrap (Vegan option included) Recipe by Sameera Sood - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Veggie wrap (Vegan option included).

ingredients.name: shredded paneer (Indian cottage cheese). Alternatively you can use shredded tofu

instructions: Heat the oil. Put cumin seeds. Add chopped onions(save some onion to add in the wrap later) when the cumin seeds strat popping.
Once the onion is soft and turns golden brown, add tomatoes. When it starts looking like a paste add salt and mustard powder(a pinch).
Now add peas and paneer in it. Cook for 2-3 minutes on medium flame. It should start looking like this.
Spread a small portion on a wrap. Add chopped carrot, cucumber, avocado, onion.

author: Experimental Foodie 13
name: Vegan French toast / Non Fried Veggies Bread Pakoras Recipe by Experimental Foodie 13 - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Vegan French toast / Non Fried Veggies Bread Pakoras. Here's my healthy version of Indian favorite snack or breakfast BREAD PAKORAS
Can be eaten for lunch also as it's so filling and packed with loads of veggies protein.
Do try.
 #oxfordstudents
#cookingwithnawamin
#oxfordstudent
instructions: To start with take 2 cups of chickpea flour or gram flour in a bowl.
Add all the Dry spices to it and mix everything well.
Now start adding water to make a smooth batter.
Make sure there are no lumps.
Now add all the greens (you can use any vegetables of your choice but in a grated or paste form)
Combine everything well.
Add more water if the batter is too thick. (should not be too thick or too watery)
Cut your breads into 4 pieces
Grease your pan with little ghee or oil (1-2 tsp if using non stick or 1/2 -1 tbsp if normal pan)
Dip bread in the batter and place them one by one in the pan.
Cook on low to medium flame until it's golden brown from both the sides.
I have tried two versions so far. This one is with zucchini and carrots.
Enjoy them with your favorite Chutney or Sauce😋
Will see you soon with another interesting recipe till then Happy cooking 😀

author: Rachel
name: Vegan lasagne Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan lasagne. I love lasagne and this vegan version follows a traditional cooking method. It was worth the effort 😊
instructions: Melt the butter, stir in the flour on a low heat for couple of minutes and gradually whisk in the plant milk. Keep stirring and it will thicken. Take off the heat and stir in the nutritional yeast and mustard. This is how I would make a normal cheese sauce but with plant-based ingredients.
Chop the veg and cook in a little oil. Add the vegan mince or lentil. Add the chopped tomatoes, garlic and herbs and bring to a simmer.
Prepare the lasagne by adding a layer of the tomato and veg, a layer of lasagne and a layer of white sauce. Top with bread crumbs or vegan Parmesan and herbs.
Bake in an oven for around 35 minutes at 200c. I served in individual dishes with a side salad 😊

author: Kelly's Kitchen
name: Mixed Berry Breakfast Smoothie (w/ vegan chocolate protein) Recipe by Kelly's Kitchen - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Mixed Berry Breakfast Smoothie (w/ vegan chocolate protein). If you're waking up early with little time to eat, try this extremely filling & healthy vegan protein shake. This breakfast shake kept me going until lunchtime! 

#berries #chocolate #veganprotein #glutenfree
instructions: Add all ingredients into a blender.
Serve and enjoy!

author: Rachel
name: Zaatar flatbread (vegan pizza) #summerchallenge1 Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Zaatar flatbread (vegan pizza) #summerchallenge1. These are lovely warm and straight from the oven (I made four but I ate one before I had a chance to take the photo!) but just as good cold and perfect for a picnic. A great dairy free alternative to pizza if you don’t eat cheese.
instructions: Make a basic pizza dough by adding the yeast to the flour and adding enough warm water to make a dough. knead for at least 10 minutes adding a few sprays of oil to help the dough to become elastic. Cover with a clean tea towel and leave to rise in a warm area for a couple of hours.
Mix the zaatar mix with a little oil and lemon juice.
Form the dough into rounds and flatten, top with the herb mix and bake in a hot oven for around 10 minutes. Top with cucumber, mint and tomato.

author: Kelly's Kitchen
name: Green & Fruity Smoothie (w/ vegan vanilla protein) Recipe by Kelly's Kitchen - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Green & Fruity Smoothie (w/ vegan vanilla protein). Delicious! I had this as a meal replacement shake. Packed with goodness and gives you lots of energy.
instructions: Add all ingredients into a blender.
Serve and enjoy!

author: Alessandra
name: Sesame Miso Chrysanthemum Leaves (or any other Greens) - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Sesame Miso Chrysanthemum Leaves (or any other Greens) - vegan. This is an easy and quick way to serve greens. I make this to go alongside some tofu and veggies 😋

ingredients.name: Sesame seeds to sprinkle on top

instructions: For the sauce: mix the tahini, miso and mirin. Add water to get the consistency how you want - not too runny but not too thick either. 🐻🐻🐻
Bring a pan of water to the boil. Add the leaves for about 30 seconds. Then remove and drain. Run cold water over them to stop them cooking. Drain again.
Then press any remaining water out of the leaves. If you want, cut the leaves into smaller pieces.
Stir some of the sauce through the leaves. Then sprinkle some sesame seeds on top and serve with the rest of the sauce on the side. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Cool green salad 😎- vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Cool green salad 😎- vegan. Perfect crunchy, cooling salad. 
Would be good with some salmon or white fish or tofu or feta. 
I like to sauté the celery first but not essential. 
Based on a Jasmine Hemsley recipe.

ingredients.name: handfuls of salad leaves eg peashoots
courgettes, grated - i squeeze some of the moisture out
celery, chopped - and if you’re sautéing it, some butter
pumpkin seeds and fennel seeds, toasted
drizzles of extra virgin olive oil

instructions: Put the salad leaves in a serving bowl.
Add the grated courgette and mint.
Either add the celery raw or sauté in some butter for 10 mins and then add.
Squeeze the lime juice over everything and fold together.
Add a few drizzles of extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle the seeds on top. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Pear and rhubarb cake - vegan and GF Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Pear and rhubarb cake - vegan and GF. I made this to use up some fruit and to see how adaptable the pear/blackberry recipe was 😁 

This works as a basic vegan/GF mix that you can add different fruit and spices to. And i love pear and rhubarb with ginger 💖

ingredients.name: pear, peeled and cored and grated
Some brown sugar/ coconut sugar/ nuts to sprinkle on top

instructions: Preheat oven to 200C.
In a bowl, mix the fruit and oil, syrup and vanilla.
In another bowl, mix the flour, almonds, spices and baking powder.
Mix the dry and wet ingredients.
Put the mix into a lined baking tin. Sprjnkle the sugar/ nuts on top. Bake for 40-50mins.
Let cool before taking out of the tin! Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Chia pudding - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Chia pudding - vegan. I love a chia pudding breakfast 💖 This is my go-to recipe and then i change the spices and fruits depending on the day.
instructions: Whisk everything together.
Leave in the fridge overnight - you can add raw fruit at this stage too so it soaks overnight.
Stir well before eating. Serve with your topping of choice 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Nepalese-style Vegetable Curry - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Nepalese-style Vegetable Curry - vegan. This is a wonderful aromatic curry you can make with any in-season vegetables. We picked carrots, daikon, fennel, leeks, spring onions this morning and made the curry for lunch 💖

ingredients.name: garlic clove, peeled and sliced finely
chunk ginger, peeled and sliced finely
vegetables of choice - chopped into small pieces
Black or pink himalayan ground salt
spring onions (mostly the green parts), chopped finely
Equal amounts ginger and garlic - peeled and blended/ processed together. Add water gradually to make it a paste
If you want to keep it for a few days (in the fridge), using oil instead of water will preserve it better

instructions: This is pretty quick to make and you need to keep stirring so it’s best to have everything chopped and ready to go.
Heat a pan (with a lid for later) on a medium-low heat. Add the oil.
Add the cumin seeds. From this point, keep stirring...The cumin will turn golden brown. Add the chilli pepper.
Add the sliced ginger and garlic. Cook for a few mins. Add the onion. Cook for a few mins more.
Add the turmeric. Stir. Add whichever vegetable(s) take the longest to cook. For us today it was the daikon. Sauté for about 5 mins.
Add the ginger garlic paste. And then the rest of the vegetables. Sauté for 2-3 mins.
Add a pinch of salt and of chilli powder. Add the ground cumin, ground coriander and garam masala.
Add the tomato. And then the water. Cover and cook til the vegetables are just tender.
Add salt and chilli powder to taste. Take off the heat. Add the fresh coriander and spring onions and stir through.
Serve with rice. Enjoy 😋

author: Sameera Sood
name: Indian style okra (Vegan) Recipe by Sameera Sood - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Indian style okra (Vegan). Okra can be a bit tricky to cook since it is so sticky! This is the only way my family enjoys eating okra #vegan #vegetarian
instructions: Cut okra in four long pieces. Add gram flour, salt, mustard, chilly powder, dry mango powder to it. Give it a good mix.
Heat oil in a deep pan. Put okra in it in small batches. I fried 400 gms of okra in 3 batches. Take it out when it turns golden brown.
Cut red onion in long thin slices.

Heat the leftover oil from frying, add cumin seeds in it. Put onions when the seeds start popping. As the onions turn golden brown and soft, add the fried okra in it and toss it nicely. Turn the heat off.
Serve with chapati, lentils or raita. It tastes delicious and is especially a hit amongst kids.

author: Rachna
name: Vegan Spanish Omelette/Tortilla Recipe by Rachna  - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Spanish Omelette/Tortilla. I learnt this recipe from my sister in law, who grew up in Spain. She adds finely chopped onions too, but I prefer my tortilla without onions, thus I add spinach instead.
instructions: Heat oil in a small frying pan and add the potatoes. Let the potatoes cook on medium heat.
Meanwhile in a mixing bowl, put the gram flour, plain flour, green chillies, spinach and salt. Add water and mix well to form a batter.
When the potatoes are soft in the middle, add them to the batter and mix well.
Pour the batter into the frying pan (the same pan in which you cooked the potatoes, so you'd not need much oil) and cook it for 6 minutes on medium to slow heat.

Place a plate over the frying pan and flip it over and turn the tortilla around and cook the other side for 6 minutes. If required, keep turning it around till it's properly cooked. Take it off the frying pan and serve hot.

author: Jess Hawker Meadley
name: Vegan “tuna” pasta salad Recipe by Jess Hawker Meadley - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan “tuna” pasta salad. Quick easy vegan alternative to tuna pasta salad #easy #vegan #quickvegan
instructions: Prep ingredients
Cook pasta and chop veg. Roughly chop tomatoes, grate carrot and dice onion
Drain brazed tofu and fork the flakes loose. Rip up nori into small bits and stir into tofu. Squeeze lemon over
Once pasta is cooked and drain stir everything in together
Add cheese if you like (this is vegan cheese)

author: Alessandra
name: Raspberry chia not-jam - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Raspberry chia not-jam - vegan. Most jams you buy in shops are full of sugar. This one is not! And it has the added bonus of chia seeds 😍
Perfect on toast or in porridge or overnight oats or in non-jam tarts 💖
instructions: Put the raspberries and maple syrup in a pan. Bring to a simmer on a medium heat. Simmer for about 5 mins. Squish the raspberries a bit with a spoon.
Add the chia seeds. Stir so it’s all combined. Simmer for another 15 mins or so. The non-jam thickens so you can cook longer if you like a thicker consistency.
Remove from the heat. Stir in the vanilla. Enjoy 😋 (Keep in the fridge in an airtight container.)

author: Malaysian Kitchen UK
name: Vegan Peanut Butter Cookies Recipe by Malaysian Kitchen UK - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Peanut Butter Cookies.

ingredients.name: Vegan Butter - I used Pure soya spread

instructions: Add the sugar and vegan butter to a mixer and beat them together until creamy. Add the peanut butter and vanilla extract and mix in.

In a separate bowl, add the flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Then add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix in (by hand, don’t use your electric mixer for this part). Test the cookie dough by trying to roll some into a ball. If it holds together perfectly then you’re good to go. If it crumbles and won’t hold together, then add in 1 Tbsp Soy Milk and test it again.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Roll the dough into balls, and then roll them in sugar and place evenly onto a parchment lined baking tray. Flatten with a fork.
Bake for 15 minutes until golden on top. They will be soft when they come out of the oven but will firm up as they cool. Enjoy

author: Alessandra
name: Spring pasta - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Spring pasta - vegan. A late change in travel plans meant i had the joy of an unexpected trip to the farmers’ market and then made lunch with all the goodies. It’s the start of the asparagus season here. This pasta is like Spring in a bowl 💚😁
The lemon is key!! 🍋🍋🍋
#pastacontest

ingredients.name: Pasta - cooked according to the type you’re using; i used orecchiette today - keep some of the cooking water to add
asparagus - snap the woody ends off and then cut into 3cm slices (after snapping the ends off, this was just over 300g)
wet garlic bulb sliced or 2-3 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed
chopped leafy herbs - today i used parsley and wild garlic; mint would be good too

instructions: Cook the pasta according to whichever type you’re using. When you drain it, keep some of the cooking water for the sauce.

Get everything ready before starting as it’s quite quick to cook. Put the asparagus and peas in a pan (with a lid for later). Add water so it’s about 2 cm deep. Put the lid in. Bring to the boil and simmer until the asparagus goes bright green. It will only take 2 mins or so. This is steaming the vegetables so they keep their colour and crunch. Drain the vegetables and set to one side.
Using the same pan (dry off any remaining water), heat the oil. Add the garlic and sauté for 2 mins.
Add the peas and asparagus. Sauté for about 3-5 mins until they are tender.
Add the herbs and lemon zest and juice to the asparagus mix. And stir in the pasta. Add 2-4 tbsp of the pasta cooking water.
Take off the heat. If you want, stir about a tbsp of butter through so it melts. Or you could add a drizzle of olive oil.
Add the nuts and stir through. Season with a generous pinch or two of sea salt and a few grinds of pepper. Enjoy 😋

author: Lewis XVII
name: Vegan mac n cheese Recipe by Lewis XVII - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan mac n cheese. Who doesn't like a comfort food like mac n cheese, but this time without the dairy. #pasta #vegan #dairyfree
instructions: Rinse the chickpeas and allow to drain. Preheat the oven to 200°.
Mix the paprika, garlic powder, chilli powder and cumin in a bowl.
Add a little oil and mix. Then add the drained chickpeas and a handful of the sliced jalapenos. Stir well, coating the chickpeas thoroughly.
Spread out on a baking tray and bake for 20 minutes.
Put the pasta on to boil. Allow 75g of pasta per person (depending on hunger).

For the 'cheese' sauce: In a small saucepan place the flour and nutritional yeast. Adding just a little of the milk alternative to mix to a lump free paste. Add the remaining milk alternative and water and stir well.
Heat gently stirring continuously until the sauce thickens.

Once the pasta is cooked, turn off the heat, drain and return to the pan with a little oil. Stir in the sauce once thick and creamy and finally add the roasted chickpeas. Serve with sweet corn on the cob and braised broccoli & spinach.

author: Alessandra
name: Red lentil dal (vegan if you sub the ghee 😁) Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Red lentil dal (vegan if you sub the ghee 😁). Dal is such a warm, nourishing comfort food 💖This version is quick and easy to make. Wonderful with rice or as a side 😋

ingredients.name: (full not just to the ‘fill’ line) red lentils (about 125g)
To garnish: some chopped spring onion and/ or coriander

instructions: Put the red lentils, water, turmeric, cumin and chilli in a saucepan (with a lid for later). Bring to the boil. Then turn down to a simmer, cover and simmer gently for about 20 mins. Stir it regularly so the lentils don’t stick. Add more water if needed.

When the lentils are ready - or about 5 mins before, add the tomatoes to the pan and stir through. Take the lentils off the heat when ready. (You can also add spinach at this point- stirring it through so it wilts.)
Heat the ghee or oil in a pan on a low- medium heat. Cook the onion and garlic, stirring regularly until soft.
When the onion/ garlic are soft, stir them (and any ghee in the pan) into the lentils.
Season. Serve and garnish with spring onions and coriander. Enjoy 😋

author: Vinnss Chuah
name: Super fiber vegan soup Recipe by Vinnss Chuah - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Super fiber vegan soup.
instructions: Cut the aspragus into half size. Keep the top part a side for topping use. The bottom part, peel of the skin and put a side that will cook with the soup.
Warm up the 3 liter pot. Add in olive oil and continue to add in all the ingredients except the chikpea, frozen vegetables and the bottom part of the aspragus.
Stir it around 1 to 2 minutes then add in the bottom part of the aspragus. Stir it a while then continue add in the chikpea and the frozen vegetables.
After that add in 500ml water. Continue to let it boil for 20min in medium heat. After 20min add in oatmilk and turn up the heat to boil it up for around 5 minutes
Then remove the soup pot a side and use the hand mixer to mix all the ingredients into liquid.
After that, put back the soup pot on the stove then add in the tapioca powder water to make the soup texture thicker.

Then warm up the frying pan, add in 1 tablespoon cooking oil and add in the top part of asparagus. Slightly fry it and add 1 tablespoon water and continue fry for 3 min in high heat, sprinkle pink of salt and pepper. Then is ready to serve as the topping on the soup.

author: Alessandra
name: Za’atar salad (can be vegan) Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Za’atar salad (can be vegan). If Fattoush and Greek salad had a love child...💖
Using up a bunch of stuff and made this fresh, crunchy salad that’s strong on flavour. 
If you have some pita bread, toast it and chop it into the salad. (I didn’t have any but i added some toasted...

ingredients.name: feta cheese (vegan if you need it to be), crumbled or cut into cubes- optional
Toasted pita bread and/ or pumpkin seeds
runny honey (or maple syrup if vegan)

instructions: Put all the chopped vegetables in a bowl.
Add the herbs.
Make the dressing. Pour over the salad. Stir and let it sit for 30 mins (or more) so all the flavours meld.
Add the feta. Sprinkle generously with za’atar. Add the pita/ seeds if you’re using. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: White asparagus with lemon and pistachios - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for White asparagus with lemon and pistachios - vegan. White asparagus is a bit more needy than the green. But this recipe keeps it simple!
instructions: Break the ends off the asparagus (the thick ends). It will break at their natural point. Peel from just below the tip.
Put in a large flat-ish pan (with a lid). Cover with water. Add the lemon juice and some of the zest. Cover and bring to the boil. Simmer for about 20 mins until you can easily cut it with a knife.
Drain the asparagus. Leave them to slightly cool.
To serve, stack them up and sprinkle with the rest of the zest, the pistachios, a splash of olive oil and a generous pinch of sea salt. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Fennel and grapefruit salad - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Fennel and grapefruit salad - vegan. This is a lovely fresh salad. Sometimes i don’t cook the fennel and onion: it’s just as good when you have them raw and the crunch is a great contrast with the fruit. 
#salad #saladcontest
instructions: Preheat the oven to 190C. Mix the fennel and onion in the oil (and vinegar if using) and season. Put on a lined baking tray and cook for about 15-20 mins so the vegetables are tender.
Slice the grapefruit (or orange) so it’s in circles and remove the peel and pith. With an orange i put the slices in as in the third photo; but the grapefruit was big so i segmented it.
When the fennel/ onion mix is cooked, lay on a plate. Lay the orange on top and then sprinkle the mint leaves on top. Serve and enjoy 😋
I forgot to take a photo before serving.. so this is part way through eating 😁 We mixed with some baby greens.

author: Alessandra
name: Carrot and Daikon Miso Soup - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Carrot and Daikon Miso Soup - vegan. This is kind of a simple, vegan version of Tonjiru 🐷 ... so probably tastes nothing like the real thing 😁 But it does taste good. It’s more of a winter soup but restorative whatever the season. 
Also good with some firm tofu added just before...

ingredients.name: Daikon - i used about 1/3 of a big daikon, peeled and chopped
Gobo root - also known as burdock root, peeled and chopped;
it discolours within milliseconds so peel then put in water with a tsp of cider vinegar. When you’re ready, slice it into matchsticks or shave as if you’re sharpening a pencil
enough water to cover the vegetables
Ginger - about a 5cm chunk, peeled and grated
some shichimi to serve - or salt, pepper and some chilli flakes

instructions: To show how much veg i used - i didn’t use quite all this chunk of daikon.
Heat the oil in a pan (with a lid for later). Sauté the carrot, daikon and gobo for about 10 mins.
Add enough water to cover the vegetables + the kombu. Bring to boil and then simmer (with the lid on) until the veg are tender.
Remove the kombu.Add the ginger and miso. Mix well.
Serve with spring onion and shichimi sprinkled on top. Enjoy 😋

author: DragonsNeedToEat
name: Vegan Friendly Hazelnut and Chocolate 'Chelsea Buns' Recipe by DragonsNeedToEat - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Vegan Friendly Hazelnut and Chocolate 'Chelsea Buns'. Of course these aren't traditional Chelsea buns but they are delicious and look tasty.

You wouldn't believe that they're vegan. Or maybe you would because vegan stuff doesn't have to be healthy. This isn't healthy.

ingredients.name: dark cane sugar (just brown will do)
single drop red food colouring or pink food colouring

instructions: Put water, yeast and sugar in a bowl and leave for about 10 minutes or until frothy.
Add melted spread and soy milk, mix.
Add 3 cups of flour and stir until it forms a ball. It'll get pretty hard to mix but hang in there. Leave the other 1/2 cup of flour.
Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic (springs back when you pull it).
Place in a lightly oiled bowl and leave to rise in a warm place for an hour or so, until it's at least doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 190°C. Take out of bowl and knead lightly on lightly floured surface. Roll out into about a 30cm X 25 cm rectangle.
Combine all filling ingredients and spread out on the rectangle, making sure it reaches the edges.
Roll from the shortest side into a log. Cut into 12 pieces with a sharp knife.
Stuff into a sponge tin and bake for about 25 minutes.
While waiting, whip up the icing by combining all ingredients. It should be a little runny.
Also while waiting combine the glaze ingredients in a saucepan on the stove until the sugar is dissolved. Strain the jelly-like pieces with a sieve.
When out of the oven, brush with glaze, it will give a much more shiny appearance.
Lastly, when the buns are cool, drizzle with icing.

author: Sonia
name: Vegan Berry Smoothie Recipe by Sonia - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Berry Smoothie. A quick smoothie to start my day as I’m trying to eat a bit less bread! Not much of a recipe I’ll grant you, but perhaps useful for some breakfast inspiration! I used a wholefood strawberry protein powder with mine, vanilla would be nice too I think. It...
instructions: Put all the ingredients in your blender and blend! Vegan protein powders can be quite powdery so I blend them really thoroughly to help with the texture.

author: Alessandra
name: Banana Bread - vegan and GF Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Banana Bread - vegan and GF. This is so good. It’s somewhere in between bread and cake - which sounds like a great place to be 😆Healthy enough for breakfast. 
If you’re not eating it straight out of the oven, you toast it. And it tastes awesome 😍
Beautiful with some butter or...
instructions: Preheat the oven to 190C.
Combine the flour, baking powder, spices and salt.
Add the lemon juice, water, coconut oil and maple syrup. Mix well.
Add the mashed bananas. Mix well.
Stir in the dates and the walnuts if using.
Put into a loaf tin - lined if it’s not a silicone one. Put the banana slices on top as decoration.
Bake for about 50 mins - until golden. It’s ready if you put a skewer in and it comes out clean. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Sweet potato chips/ fries with za’atar - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Sweet potato chips/ fries with za’atar - vegan. Inspired by this recipe from Chris when i had no paprika in the cupboard 😁

https://cookpad.com/uk/recipes/7054212-sweet-potato-chips

Always add salt after cooking these ... otherwise they shrivel up a bit and do not look or taste...

ingredients.name: big sweet potato, chopped into even sized sticks

instructions: Preheat oven to 200C.
In a bowl, mix the potato pieces with the oil and za’atar.
Put the fries onto a lined baking tray. Give them space to help them crisp.
Bake for 25-35 mins or so until tender.
Add some salt and pepper... or more za’atar. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Tofu scramble with leeks and rose harissa - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Tofu scramble with leeks and rose harissa - vegan. Inspired by Sam’s delicious recipe and Ottolenghi too. 
https://cookpad.com/uk/recipes/6612856-quick-tofu-scramble

Super-tasty and healthy breakfast ... or lunch or supper 😁

ingredients.name: red onion, finely chopped - or a couple of shallots
firm tofu, well drained and chopped into cubes

instructions: Preheat the oil in a pan. Add the onion and sauté for 10 mins or so until soft.
Add the leek and sauté for another 5-10 mins til the leeks are tender.
Add the harissa and sauté for a couple of minutes.
Add the tofu. Break the tofu up a bit so it starts to resemble scrambled eggs in texture. Heat through for a couple of mins.
Enjoy with some sourdough toast and / or salad 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Spicy mash - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Spicy mash - vegan. A spicy change from classic mashed potatoes. And it’s great on top of a shepherds pie (vegan or otherwise) or as a side.

ingredients.name: big potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks

instructions: Boil the potatoes. When they are tender, drain and then mash up with 1 tbsp olive oil and the salt. Add more oil if needed.
In a pan, heat 1/2 tbsp oil and add the garlic, shallots and chilli flakes. Sauté for about 10 mins.
Add the garlic/ shallot mix to the potatoes and stir it all together.
Enjoy as a side or on top of shepherds pie 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Berry ice-‘cream’ - can be vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Berry ice-‘cream’ - can be vegan. I make banana ice-‘cream’ a lot. Peel the banana, slice it, freeze it ... then put in the blender til it’s an ice-cream-like consistency. This time i wanted to try with berries and figured it would need something extra for the texture. Yogurt or...

ingredients.name: dessert spoons of your yogurt of choice
chill 2 cans of coconut milk and use the solid top part from each (you can use the rest of the liquid for another dish :) )
some maple syrup to sweeten if you want
some crushed pistachios and mint leaves to garnish

instructions: Put the berries in the blender.
Add the yogurt or chilled coconut milk. (I add 4 spoons of yogurt to start and then add more if needed.)
Blend til the right consistency. Add the sweetener to taste.
Serve immediately with the pistachios and mint. Enjoy 😋

author: Gaia Riva
name: Filo pastry apple strudel (can be vegan too) Recipe by Gaia Riva - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Filo pastry apple strudel (can be vegan too). The strudel is my mum signature dish she can make it with her eyes closed. Lately I have been preferring using filo pastry because it makes it lighter and less buttery

ingredients.name: butter (melted) - you can make it vegan by using oil instead

instructions: Turn on the oven on 200. Put the raisin to soften in hot water. Peal the apples and cut them in little chunks
Add the pine nuts and sugar to the apples and stir well. Drain the raisin and add them too

In my filo pastry box there were 7 sheets although the number varies based on brands. I recommend to keep each strudel to no more than 4 sheets, so in this case I made one with 4 and one with 3 sheets. Layer one sheet on flat surface and with a brush coat the sheet lightly with butter. It doesn’t need to be soaking it just helps in making it crispy and tasty. Add another sheet and add the butter again

When you have you 3 or 4 sheets add half of the apple mix into the middle of the pastry. Close the shorter edges first and then the longer sides. I purposely don’t close the sheet as the apples can create too much water whilst cooking sometimes.

Repeat the same process with the second stride starting by alternating the pastry sheets and then adding the apple mix. When both are done use the remaining butter and brush it on top of both strudels to make it golden but also to help keeping the edges together.
Put the strudels in the oven and cook for 30 minutes at 180 degrees and another 15 min at 140 degrees. Serve hot with a sprinkle of icing sugar and with vanilla ice cream 😋

author: Sonia
name: Vegan Buckwheat Flour Pancakes Recipe by Sonia - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Buckwheat Flour Pancakes. Yay it’s #PancakeDay! Today I’m going to see how many different pancakes I can create in the #CookpadKitchen. Starting with ones I can actually eat myself! Egg-free for me and gluten-free for Becky.
instructions: Whisk the ingredients together in a large bowl and ideally leave to stand for 30 minutes.
Heat a tsp of oil in a non-stick frying pan on a medium high heat. Put a small ladle if batter in the pan. Wait for it to bubble up and firm around the edges before you flip it over.

author: Alessandra
name: Date and coconut rice - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Date and coconut rice - vegan. I 💖 rice pudding for breakfast and this one is sweet and satisfying  😋
#brunch #vegan

ingredients.name: brown rice, rinsed and soaked (even if just for 30 mins)
water - maybe a little more/ less
grated creamed coconut (desiccated coconut would work too)
dried dates, soaked in water if they are very dry - chopped into small pieces

instructions: Put the rice, coconut milk, most of the water, cardamom and ginger in a pan. Bring to the boil. Simmer until the rice is cooked - about 40-45 mins. Add a little more water if needed.
When the rice is almost cooked, stir in the grated coconut and most of the dates.
Serve with a little more coconut grated on top and the rest of the dates. Enjoy 😋

author: goodfoodgoodlife
name: Vegan mixed veggies curry Recipe by goodfoodgoodlife - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Vegan mixed veggies curry. #holispecial 
This colourful mixed veggies curry is very healthy & yummy.Its also suitable for vegans.Its onion garlic free recipe.
instructions: Wash & cut the veggies of your choice.In a pan add oil,cumin seeds & turmeric powder.Throw in the mixed veggies add salt & mix well.Cover & cook untill veggies become tender.
Now add in little water coriander powder,garam masala,chilli powder & pinch of sugar(optional).
Finally add coconut milk & crushed dry fenugreek leaves(kasuri methi).Cook for another 5 mins & its done.Serve with hot Roti(indian flat bread)or Poori.

author: Alessandra
name: Green soup for Spring - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Green soup for Spring - vegan. 💚💚💚 
Full of spring goodness. Super easy to make more - and easy to add whatever vegetables you have. Adding some cooked pasta is also good.

ingredients.name: green beans, topped and tailed and chopped
from a few sprigs of thyme
Some chopped parsley - so you get about a tablespoonful
spinach leaves, torn or chopped - rocket works well too
wild garlic, torn or chopped - optional

instructions: Heat the oil in a pan. Add the garlic and celery. Sauté for about 10 mins til softened and starting to go translucent.
Add the courgette, beans and leeks. Sauté for another 10 mins.
Add the herbs and the stock. Stir well and simmer for 5-10 mins.
Add the peas and the lemon juice. Simmer for another 5 mins.
Take the pan off the heat. Stir through the spinach and wild garlic so they wilt. Add a few grinds of pepper. Serve and enjoy 😋

author: Jess Hawker Meadley
name: Vegan Cottage pie for babies Recipe by Jess Hawker Meadley - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Cottage pie for babies. Weaning friendly no salt baby food. #babyfood #weaning #vegan
instructions: Ingredients ✅
Cook carrots, onions and garlic in oil. Chop thinly and cook until soft
Dice potatoes and put on to boil

When onions, carrots & garlic is cooked & soft add lentils with water and oregano. You can also add more herbs here to taste (depending on where you baby is in weaning). Crank the heat so the lentils cook, stirring regularly
Keep stirring lentils and adding water as necessary until they are cooked. And if you need to walk off and look after your baby turn the hob off. Don’t forget and burn the whole thing.... 🙋🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️😭
When potatoes are cooked, drain and leave to cool. When they are room temperature blend with baby milk of choice (breast or formula)
When lentils are cooked, leave to cool and blend with baby milk of choice. You may also want to add peas for protein.
Portion for baby together like a cottage pie, with lentils and potato in each portion. Making as big as your baby would like.

Note on storage. For baby food mixed with breast milk this can be kept in the fridge for 3 days from when the milk was pumped and 6 months in the freezer. For formula follow your providers instructions.

author: Alessandra
name: Rhubarb, pear and ginger crumble - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Rhubarb, pear and ginger crumble - vegan. First rhubarb of the season 💖
Love rhubarb and love it alongside pear and ginger 😋
If you really love ginger, you can add some to the topping too. 
And it’s healthy enough for breakfast 😊

ingredients.name: pears, peeled and cored and chopped into 3 cm chunks
maple syrup or coconut sugar (add more if you need it sweeter)
chunk of ginger, peeled and grated - optional
oats ground into a flour in the blender
maple syrup (or honey if you’re not making it vegan)
Some walnuts broken into small pieces or flaked almonds

instructions: Preheat oven to 170C.
In a baking dish/ pie dish, put the fruit and then stir in the rest of the filling ingredients. Put it in the oven for about 10 mins.
Meanwhile, put all the dry ingredients for the topping into a bowl. Mix well.
In a pan, gently heat the coconut oil and maple syrup until melted and combined.
Pour the oil/syrup mix into the bowl with the dry ingredients.
Take the pie dish out of the oven. Press the oat topping mix on top of the fruit. Sprinkle the nuts on top. Bake for 25-35 mins until the top is golden brown.
Serve and enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Rice pudding with rhubarb and ginger - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Rice pudding with rhubarb and ginger - vegan. I 💖 rhubarb and I ❤️rice pudding so this is a happy dish! Healthy enough for breakfast 😋

ingredients.name: brown rice, rinsed and drained (and soaked for at least 30 mins if possible)
milk of choice - i usually use 1 can of coconut milk and top up with water; or 2 cups almond milk
vanilla bean, scraped - you’ll add the seeds and the pod
green cardamom pods, crushed - or 1/4 tsp ground cardamom
cinnamon stick - nice to have, not essential :)

instructions: For the rice pudding: put everything in a pan (with a lid.) Bring to the boil. Cover and simmer for about 30mins until the rice is cooked and tender. Add more liquid if the mix runs dry. When it’s ready, lift out the cinnamon stick and vanilla bean (and cardamom pods if you can find them) before serving.
For the rhubarb: put everything in a pan and simmer until the rhubarb is tender about 15-20 mins.
Serve the rice with the rhubarb on top or on the side and enjoy 😋

author: Abbimc
name: Vegan Pesto Pasta Salad Recipe by Abbimc - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Pesto Pasta Salad. Quick tasty lunch in the #CookpadKitchen - works with a range of veggies & is a good way to use up some greens!
instructions: Cook the macaroni, add a pinch of salt & splash of olive oil to the water. Drain and leave to cool.
Chop all the veggies and Greek style cheese into even pieces.
Mix the veggies into the pasta, then stir through as much pesto as you like! About 2-3 tablespoons. Add salt and pepper to taste.

author: Alessandra
name: Passion fruit energy balls - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Passion fruit energy balls - vegan. Zingy energy balls that smell and taste wonderful 🧡 Try substituting in ground hemp for added protein. 
Store in the fridge. 
And if you’re in need of a chocolate hit, try these ......

ingredients.name: desiccated coconut + extra to cover the balls
ground flaxseed (sometimes i use a mix of flax and sunflower seeds)

instructions: Strain the passion fruit to get the juice and the pulp. The seeds will be left in the strainer.
Put everything into the blender. Blend until everything comes together and is almost fudge like in consistency.
Roll into balls. Roll into some desiccated coconut if you want. Chill the balls in the fridge before eating. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
servings: 2 as a main; 4 as a side
name: Lentil and rhubarb stew - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Lentil and rhubarb stew - vegan. Yes, lentil + rhubarb ... ! Inspired by a Mark Bittman recipe. I first made it out of curiosity then loved it! The rhubarb adds a depth to the dish and some people don’t guess it’s rhubarb!

ingredients.name: chunk fresh ginger, peeled and grated
chilli flakes and fresh coriander to sprinkle on top

instructions: Put everything - except the chilli flakes and coriander - in a pan. Add enough water to cover.
Simmer until the lentils and rhubarb are quite soft - 20-30mins. Add more water if needed.
Serve with the chilli and coriander sprinkled on top. Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Celery and lettuce juice - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Celery and lettuce juice - vegan. 💚 green juice

ingredients.name: small cucumber or 1/2 cucumber, chopped into chunks
coconut water - or a few ice cubes or water

instructions: Put everything in the blender. Blitz til smooth.
Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Chocolatey black bean bites - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description:
Great recipe for Chocolatey black bean bites - vegan. Making cookies with black beans was probably the first healthy baking recipe i tried. It was a real #cookingdiscovery : that you could use something healthy and full of protein like black beans to make something fudgy and delicious 😍
These...

ingredients.name: ground hemp seeds (flaxseeds work well too)
Generous pinch of sea salt + more for sprinkling
dried sour cherries (unsweetened and with no oil used)
about 75g of 80% chocolate, chopped - or chocolate chips or vegan chocolate chips

instructions: Preheat oven to 190C.
Mix the maple syrup, vanilla, chia and flaxseeds in a bowl.
Put the beans, cayenne, cacao, maca, coconut oil and salt in a food processor or blender. Mix til all combined and smooth.
Add the maple/ chia mix and milk to the bean mix. Mix together. It’ll be quite a sticky texture.
Fold in the chocolate and cherries.
Take about a heaped teaspoonful of mix and roll into a ball. Place onto a lined baking sheet.
Flatten each ball slightly. Sprinkle with sea salt. Bake for 15-20 mins.
Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Pear and blackberry cake - vegan and GF Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Pear and blackberry cake - vegan and GF. This is a good way to use up some extra fruit 😋 It’s quite ‘wet’ as a cake because of the fruit and definitely needs the cooling time or it crumbles completely ... it still tastes good that way though 😁

ingredients.name: maple syrup - maybe a little less if the fruit is super-sweet

instructions: Pre-heat oven to 200° C
In a bowl, mix the fruit and coconut oil, maple syrup and vanilla.
In another bowl, mix the flour ground almonds, spices and baking powder.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients mix until combined. Put the mixture into a lined baking tin. Sprinkle the walnuts on top and bake for 40-50 minutes.
Once it’s baked, leave to cool for 10-15 mins in the tin (or it collapses...) and then on a cooling rack.
Enjoy 😋

author: Alessandra
name: Wild garlic pesto - vegan Recipe by Alessandra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Wild garlic pesto - vegan. Fast way to use some wild garlic: great with pasta, with smashed potatoes or on flatbreads. (You can also add some parmesan/ veggie or vegan equivalent.)
instructions: Put the garlic, walnuts and lemon juice in a blender or processor. Blend until it’s chopped up.
Season. And then add the olive oil a little at a time. Keep processing until it’s at a texture you like. Taste and season again as necessary.
Enjoy 😋

author: Elle
name: Vegan Scrambled Tofu Recipe by Elle - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Scrambled Tofu. Make sure to use extra firm tofu, I buy 'The Tofoo Co' from Sainsbury's or Waitrose.
instructions: Prepare the tofu by lightly pressing dry inside a tea towel or some kitchen roll and roughly chop into squares of around 1inch. Make sure not to crumble the tofu as this will change the end texture.
Prepare the 'eggy' mixture by combining the rest of the ingredients (minus the chives and oil) in a small bowl and set aside.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan on a high heat. Once the oil is hot add the tofu and cook on a medium heat, stirring occasionally for around 8 minutes or until some of the tofu begins to brown slightly.

Pour the 'eggy' mixture over the browned tofu and gently stir to combine. Cook on a medium to high heat allowing the liquid to simmer around the tofu for around 8 minutes or until the majority of the liquid is absorbed by the tofu.
Serve immediately and garnish with chives.

author: Rachel
name: Strawberry Chokladbollar (vegan) Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Strawberry Chokladbollar (vegan). I prefer to make savoury recipes but I love these. They are so easy to make, there is no need to cook and they are always first to go at a party! Traditionally these are not vegan and you can use normal butter if you prefer. We picked loads of...
instructions: Mix together the butter, coco powder and oats in a food processor until you have a soft ball. I always think that I haven’t added enough oil but it usually comes together but add more if you need it.
Cover each strawberry in the mixture until you have a ball and roll in the coconut. Refrigerate for a couple of hours and they are ready to eat. They keep well for around 24 hours.

author: Rekha Bapodra
name: Carrot truffles vegan Recipe by Rekha Bapodra - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Carrot truffles vegan.
instructions:
In a pan add the carrots and sugar and let it cook until the sugar is absorbed. It can take up-to 10 minutes or so depending on your pan. Add the rose essence, pistachios, almond powder and coconut flour and mix well. Turn off the gas and let it cool for few minutes. 
You can roll in coconut powder or nuts if preferred.

author: Sara Telahoun
name: Vegan chorizo and veggie stew Recipe by Sara Telahoun - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan chorizo and veggie stew. This was a random recipe using up lots of leftovers lying around the kitchen. The kidney beans I used happened to come in a chili sauce so you may want to add some more spice and sauce like tomato paste if it's not looking thick enough.

ingredients.name: vegan chorizo sausages (I used Saunsburys) quartered
frozen broccoli defrosted (can also use fresh boiled)

instructions: Prepare all the ingredients
Heat a pan with the oil, onions and garlic till softened. Add the chorizo and cover to brown, about 4mins, uncovering to turn the chorizo half way.
Add the kidney beans and both types of paprika and cook for a further 3 minutes covered. Add a splash of water if the mixture dries out.
Add the rest of the ingredients and cook till thick. Season well with salt and pepper.

author: Daniel Lim
name: Vegan Apple Tarte Tartin Recipe by Daniel Lim - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan Apple Tarte Tartin. Do you ever get mindblown when you found something out of the norm during your grocery shopping? That's what happened to me. I was actually browsing some frozen puff pastries in the frozen section in a supermarket and found out there is actually a vegan...

ingredients.name: Frozen Vegan Puff Pastry Thawed But Chilled, 200g Less or More

instructions: Preheat oven to 190 degree celsius or 375 fahrenheit.
In a large mixing bowl, add melted butter, muscovado sugar and cinnamon.
Set aside.
Swirl the skillet until butter and sugar are well combined.
Continue cooking until bubbles start to form again.
Drizzle any leftover liquid from the melted butter mixture over the apples.
While the apples are baking, roll out puff pastry to about 1/4 thick and slightly bigger than your skillet.
Use an offset spatula to tuck the sides of the puff pastry into the apples.
Remove from oven and set aside to cool down for 30 mins.
Confidently flip.

author: Rachel
name: Flaxseed egg (vegan egg replacement) Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Flaxseed egg (vegan egg replacement). A flaxseed egg can be used as an alternative to an egg in many baking recipes. Well known in vegan circles they work for muffins, cakes, brownies, stuffing, pancakes and much more. They have a nutty taste which I love but they can’t be...
instructions: Mix one teaspoon of flaxseed with 3 teaspoons of water. Leave for 15 minutes until thickened. This can now be used as a replacement for an egg in lots of recipes (although a little bit of trial and error is required).

author: Rachel
name: Vegan spanakopita (spinach pie) #bakingcontest Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan spanakopita (spinach pie) #bakingcontest. I love spinach and this pie is easy to make, can be enjoyed hot or cold and I think it’s delicious! You can use regular feta and 2 beaten eggs in place of the tofu for a non-vegan version.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220c. Defrost and drain the spinach and remove any remaining water by squeezing between a paper towel. Drain the tofu. Chop the onion and shallot and cook in a pan with a little oil. Add the chopped garlic chives (or spring onion) and chopped garlic and cook gently for a further 2 minutes.

Add the spinach to the pan and cook for a further few minutes, stirring to combine. Crumble in the drain tofu and continue to stir for 2 more minutes. Turn off the heat and add the vegan feta (or regular feta if you prefer) a squeeze of lemon juice and a pinch of salt and pepper.

My secret tip is spray oil, it’s so much easier than using a pastry brush (but a pastry brush is fine if you prefer). With a light touch - oil the tray and line with your first sheet of filo. Oil again and place your next sheet in the opposite direction. Continue this process with all of the pastry. Add the pie filling and wrap with the first sheet of pastry. Repeat the oiling process until all of the party wraps the pie. Turn over the pie and sprinkle with the onion seeds and a pinch of salt.
Bake in the oven at 220c for around 18 minutes or until the pastry is crispy and golden. Sprinkle with a few chopped garlic chives if you like. The pie can be enjoyed hot or cold.

author: Rachel
name: Aquafaba (vegan egg replacement) Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Aquafaba (vegan egg replacement). Translating literally to bean water, this is an amazing alternative to egg whites and be used to make cakes, fluffy pancakes, meringue and soufflé. Great for vegan and dairy free baking it can be used as an alternative to a flaxseed or chia egg...

ingredients.name: or jar of chickpeas liquid only)

instructions: Drain the water from a can or jar of chickpeas into in a bowl. Using an electric or hand whisk, whisk the liquid until it forms stiff peaks resembling egg whites. This will usually take around 5 -10 minutes. Tip: if you are having any difficulty, add a few pinches of cream if tartar. You can now use this in lots of recipes that require egg whites.
Don’t forget to save the chickpeas. There are lots of lovely chickpea recipes on Cookpad!

author: Rachel
name: Vegan chickpea curry with pickles 🌱 Recipe by Rachel - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Vegan chickpea curry with pickles 🌱. I love spicy curries and this is an absolute favourite. It’s spicy, sweet and sour and I served with quick pickled red onion and red chilli, fresh coriander, pomegranate and lots of lemon.  I love fresh curry leaves and the added toppings make...

ingredients.name: Chopped red chilli (marinated in a little white vinegar)

instructions: Put a cross on the top of the tomatoes and put in. Bowl covered with boiling water - this will make it easy to remove the skins later. Cube the sweet potatoes and roast in the oven for 20 minutes. Cook the chopped onions in a little oil on a medium heat for 2 minutes and then turn to a low heat and put a lid on the pan. You may need to stir occasionally but the onions will turn a soft brown.
Crush the garlic and prepare the chillis by washing and making a little slit in the side (larger if you like it spicy)

Add the hard spices to the onions (star anise, cumin seeds, cardamom) and then add the curry leaves. The curry leaves will sizzle a little but don’t let them burn. add the crushed garlic and chilli and stir for a further couple of minutes.
Add the ground spices, peel the tomatoes and add them to the pan and cook on a low heat. They will break down quickly but you can cop or squash to speed things up.
When the tomatoes have formed a sauce add the chickpeas and the cooked cubes potatoes.
Sprinkle with lots of coriander, a good squeeze of lemon, pickled red onion and some fresh pomegranate seeds. Serve with lime, mint and coconut chutney and breads or rice

author: undevelopedbruce
name: Bruce’s Vegan Cottage Pie Recipe by undevelopedbruce - Cookpad
description: Great recipe for Bruce’s Vegan Cottage Pie. There is no story. I just like cottage pie. It’s vegan though. All ingredients interchangeable with other things.

ingredients.name: Cottage Pie mix (or Bisto+garlic powder+thyme+teaspoon tomato paste)
Few glugs of port or red wine

instructions: Finely chop the celery, onion and one carrot, and soften in a cooking oil of your choice for a few minutes, in a big sauce pan. After a minute, add the also finely chopped garlic and some chilli flakes if you like.
Chop up a bunch of other vegetables, not necessarily what I listed. Whatever you want or have to hand.
Add all of the things into the pan, and heat up some water for potato cooking while this cooks.
Chop up your potatoes and add them to the hot water. Pop a lid on that and cook all the things on let’s say a medium heat until the potatoes are cooked.
Strain the potatoes, then add some margerine, thyme, salt and cream if you’re feeling indulgent. MASH.
Put the insidey mix in a bowl, top with the mash and some yeast flakes to top if you want. There ya go.

author: undevelopedbruce
name: Chickpeas on toast (easy vegan lunch) Recipe by undevelopedbruce - Cookpad
